text:
Message 3720 of 4024
They jumped him. The heart  rhythm is normal now. They will monitor for. An hour and send us home. There will be a follow up but hoping this is
a one and done.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 12:28 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 08/16/2024 at 12:28 AM)
Subject:Max
Message 3721 of 4024
Thanks for the update. It’s great news to hear. I’d like to stay updated but I assume this means you blocked me where we were communicating all
night.
So now I need to move here to track emails rather than actually communicate and ask questions. That is super unfortunate. But I am at your mercy.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 12:33 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: Never)
Subject:Re: Max
Message 3722 of 4024
When can I ask questions for the doctor since you are our only mouthpiece and have gone from email, to text, to call, to text, to OFW in the space of a
few hours. It’s really hard to chase you down and communicate in a timely way when I’m playing Where’s Waldo about my son’s heart condition.
Please ask:
• What might have caused this AFib episode, and how can we make sure it doesn’t happen again?
• What kind of follow-up or monitoring should we do to keep an eye on his heart health?
• Is there anything long-term we should be concerned about, or could this be a sign of something else?
Beyond my family history, if you remember this time last year I was solving his cardio problem. I think that was a total of five appointments in three
weeks? I also track everything with his medication and ADHD treatment. I hope you will involve me next time. I know more about Max and his
health and medication than anyone alive, including him. I can help.
Sent:08/16/2024 at 12:50 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 08/16/2024 at 03:21 AM)
Subject:Re: Max
Message 3723 of 4024
Max is home and resting. Everything is normal. I’ll share more in the morning
Sent:08/16/2024 at 03:22 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 08/16/2024 at 07:23 AM)
Subject:Re: Max
